summary.title: Council Dog Infrastructure Model
summary.description:
Description:
1. Register a dog
Owners can register their dogs on the Council’s application webpage. They use their personal details, i.e. pronoun,
first and last name, email address, and physical address where the dog will be located and where the tag needs to be
shipped to (same address for both). When registering the dog, they submit its name, and breed. Upon completion
of the registration process, they receive a unique registration number, and an expiry date for the registration. An
invoice is generated in PDF and sent by email to the owner, that the owner will have to pay by bank transfer,
indicating the registration number in reference. A tag with a unique ID is created. The tag ID is an 8 digit unique
number such that at any time, there are no dogs with the same tag ID. The tag will be sent to the address indicated
by the owner.

2. Renew a registration
Before the end of a registration (typically after a year since the registration), owners have to renew a dog’s registration.
To this end, they have to input the latest tag ID, and the address to deliver the new tag to. A new invoice
will be created and sent to the email address matching that tag. The new tag, with a new ID, will be associated to
the dog previously associated to the tag to renew.

3. Terminate a registration
Owners can terminate a dog’s registration in the event of moving to a new city, the dog being passed to a new
owner, or the dog’s death. To terminate a dog’s registration, the owner needs to input their email address, the tag
ID, and the dog’s name. A confirmation email will be sent to the owners to confirm that the dog is not registered
anymore, and that the tag can be destroyed. The email also contains a link to the registration process on the
Council’s application in case the dog’s registration was terminated by mistake.

4. Declare a lost dog.
Owners can report their dog as lost. To this end, they need to encode their email address used to register the dog,
and the dog’s name. The Council system will send a confirmation email of the dog’s lost status, with the last known
tag ID, also displayed on the confirmation webpage.

5. Report a found dog.
Members of the public can report found dogs that seem to be lost. For this, they have to input the dog’s tag ID,
and a physical address where the dog is currently located, so dog services can come and pick it up. The Council will
then contact the owner on their email address, matching the tag ID.

List of Actors:
1. Dog Owners: These are people who interact with the system intending to register a dog, or who have an existing registration.
2. Members of the Public: These are people who interact with the system to report found dogs. Dog owners can be members of the public, as can council employees.
3. Council Employees: These are people employed by the Council with special credentials.

List of Constraints and Dependencies:
- The system must be available publicly on a website from both desktop and mobile devices
- The full software application is deployed on-premise, controlled by the Council's staff
- Council staff maintain the infrastructure (hardware) that runs the software application

List of Trust Levels:

List of Entry/Exit Points:

List of Assets:

Potential Improvements to Functional Aspects, and Threat Analysis:

data.name: Council Internal Systems
data.description: Processes and stores within these boundaries are maintained by the Council.

data.name: Dog Owner
data.description: A person who legally owns one or more dogs and is in the council's range of authority, so wants to register their dog or manage their already existing regulations.

data.name:
Register Dog 
Web Page
data.description:
HTTPS web page endpoint(s) and api(s) that are used for dog registration.
(Requires the user to be logged in.)

threats.title: Fake Information
threats.description: Someone could enter fake information, meaning the authorities no longer know who owns the dog, or if the dog even exists.
threats.mitigation:
- Use a system like Real Me to verify the person's identity.
- Make people send a photo of them self holding photo ID
- Check the email address/physical address are legitimate (filter for common fake subdomains)

threats.title: Claim against Registration
threats.description: Owner performs registration, then claims they didn't register any such dog.
threats.mitigation: - Log all registration actions to the system. Include relevant information about the request, i.e., IP address, time/date

threats.title: Website spoofing
threats.description: Someone could create a fake version of this website, causing people to give their information to the wrong people.
threats.mitigation:
- Prioritise shorter URLs
- Purchase and redirect from similar domains

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could flood the end point with fake applications, which causes real applications to be missed as it overwhelms the server.
threats.mitigation:
Rate limit the endpoint

Have a white list for allowed requests.

data.name: Dog Datastore
data.description: Stores information relating to dog entities known under the council.

threats.title: Database Injection
threats.description: Injection attacks could be used to change the database's information.
threats.mitigation:
- Follow industry practices for sanitising input
- Ensure all libraries used are up-to-date and screened for CSE vulnerabilities
- Create frequent backups of the database and store them externally

threats.title: Disclosure by Injection
threats.description: Injection attacks could be used to get information.
threats.mitigation:
- Follow industry practices for sanitising input
- Ensure all libraries used are up-to-date and screened for CSE vulnerabilities

threats.title: Flooding Attack
threats.description: Too many requests in a short amount of time could overwhelm the data store and cause it to stop.
threats.mitigation: Rate limit interactions with the datastore.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: If an attacker gains access to the database, then they could view all the information in the database easily.
threats.mitigation: Hash all user information by the password with salt so that user information can only be received if you have the user name and password.

threats.title: Repudiation
threats.description: Someone could make a change or update to the database and claim that they did not in the future.
threats.mitigation: Log all requests with the database.

data.name: renew invoice details
data.description: Contains details pertinent to the renew registration email invoice that were not obtained in the web form process: full name, pronouns, registration number, and email address.

data.name: terminate email details
data.description: Contains details for personalising the termination confirmation email that were not obtained in the terminate process: the owner's full name and pronouns, and the registration ID.

data.name: termination details
data.description: Contains tag ID and flag for if a dog's registration has been terminated.

data.name: lost dog email details
data.description: Contains the dog's tag ID, along with details for email personalisation -- owner's full name and pronouns.

data.name: renew details
data.description: Contains both the old and new tag IDs, the new physical address, and a new expiry date. Sets the flag is_paid to false.

data.name: Sign In
data.description: Council credentials, including email and password.

data.name: lost dog details
data.description: Contains the owner's email address, dog's name, and status to update to.

data.name: lost dog email
data.description: Confirmation email for a lost dog declaration, confirming the dog's last known tag ID.

threats.title: Intercepted email
threats.description: Email could be intercepted and user information could be gained.
threats.mitigation: Ensure that email is sent over a secure connection using TLS and have checksums.

threats.title: Modified email
threats.description: Email could be modified to add incorrect information or fake links.
threats.mitigation: Ensure that email is sent over a secure connection using TLS and have checksums.

data.name: lost dog form
data.description: Form consisting of the owner's email address and dog's name.

threats.title: Flood of fake form requests
threats.description: If too many fake form requests are made the servers could get overwhelmed and limit actual users.
threats.mitigation:
Rate limit the number of form requests per user IP.
Limit the amount a dog can be lost to once an hour.

threats.title: Man in the middle attack
threats.description: Form data could be altered with a man in the middle attack allowing for wrong information of dog being lost or for code to be added into the form.
threats.mitigation: Ensure that HTTPS is used to encrypt the data.

data.name: confirmation email
data.description: Personalised email addressed to the owner confirming that the dog of specified ID is no longer registered. Includes a link to the registration page.

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: Data could be tampered with via a man-in-the-middle attack, altering the re-registration link to direct somewhere else.
threats.mitigation: Ensure the email is sent via TLS.

threats.title: Data Interception
threats.description: The email could be intercepted, allowing an attacker to obtain the owner's pronouns, full name, and email address.
threats.mitigation: Ensure the email is sent via TLS.

data.name: terminate form data
data.description: Form data sent for terminating a dog registration. Contains the owner's email address, tagID, and dog's name.

threats.title: Data Interception
threats.description: Form data could be intercepted, allowing an attacker to obtain the sender's email address.
threats.mitigation: Use HTTPS to encrypt the form data.

threats.title: Flooding Attack
threats.description: Attackers could flood the termination form page with illegitimate requests, denying its use by legitimate actors.
threats.mitigation: Rate limit the number of form requests accepted per IP address. Implement a captcha test before forms can be sent. Filter requests upstream using an external protection service, such as Amazon Shield or Cloudflare to check packets against known attacker addresses.

data.name: renew invoice email
data.description: Personalised email addressed to the owner, with invoice attached as a PDF.

threats.title: Interception of Data
threats.description: Email could be intercepted by an attacker, granting them access to the registration owner's pronouns, full name, and email address.
threats.mitigation: Ensure the email is sent via TLS.

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle Attack
threats.description:
Data could be tampered with via a man-in-the-middle attack, altering the invoice details, such as amount owed, or the bank account (i.e., if the invoice contains the account number, the number could be altered. If the invoice or email instead contains instructions on where to find the account number, these instructions could be altered, perhaps to point to a spoofed website).
The PDF could also be altered to contain malicious executable code.
threats.mitigation: Ensure the email is sent via TLS.

data.name: renew form data
data.description: Form consisting of dog's tag ID and new delivery address.

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: A man-in-the-middle attacker could tamper with the form data, altering the physical address field to send it to.
threats.mitigation: Use HTTPS to encrypt the form data, and send the form data with a generated hash to ensure it hasn't been tampered.

threats.title: Data interception
threats.description: An attacker could intercept the data sent, obtaining the sender's physical address and tag ID.
threats.mitigation: Use HTTPS to encrypt the data.

threats.title: Flooding Attack
threats.description: An attacker could flood the renew registration page with illegitimate form requests, denying its use by legitimate actors.
threats.mitigation: Rate limit the number of form requests accepted per IP address. Implement a captcha test before forms can be sent. Filter requests upstream using an external protection service, such as Amazon Shield or Cloudflare to check packets against known attacker addresses.

data.name: Request Tag
data.description: The council employee manually requests the tags to be made and shipped to the address that the invoice is related to.
data.reasonOutOfScope: The council employee manually requests the tags to be made and shipped out of any of the systems.

data.name: found dog details
data.description: Contains the dog's tag ID, current status, and possibly the reported sighting address.

data.name: found dog form
data.description: Contains: last address of dog, dog tag ID

threats.title: Insecure connection/Adversary in the middle
threats.description: An adversary-in-the-middle intercepts the form and modifies its content. (Change location or dog tag ID)
threats.mitigation:
Use Transport Layer Security for the communication
Use secure connection, https-only and secure cookie with unique session id.
Add encryption/checksums to information.

threats.title: Address publicly accessible
threats.description: When submitting a form, the current location of the member of the public or the dog could be visible to anyone.
threats.mitigation:
Use a secure transfer protocol.
Encrypt information.

threats.title: Flooding of forms
threats.description: More than one found dog form coming from the same user within a few seconds.
threats.mitigation:
Disallow multiple requests from the same origin IP (IP blocking after multiple calls) within a few seconds.
Block IPs from known attackers.
Implement Captcha system.

data.name: Found dog details
data.description:
Information necessary for animal control to find and return dog.
Last address of dog, dog tag ID, dog breed, owner’s address

data.name: Request Invoice Information
data.description: The information for the provided reference that is required to send the tag is retrieved, so the dog ID and the address.

data.name: Update Invoice State
data.description: The invoice is marked as paid for the provided reference.

data.name: credentials
data.description: Employee credentials (i.e., email/password)

data.name: Lost dog notification
data.description:
Notifies animal control about lost dogs and any information on them.
(Last address of dog, dog tag ID, dog breed, owner’s address, etc)

threats.title: Information sent to more people
threats.description: Information sent to people in animal control who will not be dealing with the form.
threats.mitigation: Have the notification only sent to persons who will be collecting the dog

threats.title: Flooded with fake notifications
threats.description: If too many fake notifications are sent then animal control won't be able to accurately collect dogs.
threats.mitigation:
Disallow multiple requests from the same origin IP (IP blocking after multiple calls) within a few seconds.
Disallow requests not from known IPs (such as the council)
Block IPs from known attackers.
Limit the amount a dog can be lost to once an hour.

threats.title: Man in the middle
threats.description: Man in the middle attack could be performed on the notification if there is an insecure connection, allowing for information sent to animal control to be modified.
threats.mitigation:
Ensure that HTTPS is used to encrypt the data.
Verify a dog with the given ID exists and is lost.
Verify the last address of the dog is within a reasonable distance of the owner's address.
Verify the identity of the owner when returning the dog.
Encrypt information.

threats.title: Notification details publicly accessible
threats.description: Malicious actor could intercept information such as dog details, dog location, owner’s address, etc.
threats.mitigation:
Use a secure transfer protocol.
Encrypt information.

data.name: ack and send tag id
data.description: acknowledges that a regulation was successful and gets the generated unique dog ID

data.name: Add registration details
data.description: Contains all of the details from the registration form: the human pronoun, first and last name, email address, and physical address, and the dog's name and breed. This information is used to create a new entry in the database.

data.name: Logs Manage Resistraion
data.description: Contains all actions taken while managing the registration.

data.name: Log Data Base
data.description: Logs every request to the database

data.name: Log registration
data.description: Logs all registrations or attempts at registration

data.name: Log Mail
data.description: Logs all requests to send mail and all mail that is sent

data.name: Registration triggered Invoice Details
data.description: Once registration details have been updated, invoice details are generated in the database and sent to the mail service.

data.name: Send Invoice
data.description: An invoice is generated and mailed to the dog owner.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could be a man in the middle and spy on people using the application for getting information like their address and email.
threats.mitigation: All emails would be encrypted, so this information could not be disclosed.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could be a man in the middle and change information in the invoices so that the invoice is instead sent to them.
threats.mitigation: All emails would be encrypted, so the emails can't be changed and produce meaningful data.

data.name: Pay Registration Invoice
data.description: The dog owner pays for the invoice from their registration with the details listed in the invoice.
data.reasonOutOfScope: The system only indirectly interacts with this as dog owners pay outside the system and council employees check the accounts outside the system.

data.name: Recieve Invoice
data.description: Council employees check that the bank transfers made to the assacated bank account.
data.reasonOutOfScope: The system only indirectly interacts with this as dog owners pay outside the system and council employees check the accounts outside the system.

data.name: Recieve data linked to Invoice
data.description: The employee receives the data linked to the reqeasted invoice so that they can create and send a tag, so the address and the dog id

data.name: Request Invoice Data
data.description: The employee enters the invoice reference to find information about the linked dog owner so that they can create and send the tag.

data.name: Notify Invoice Received
data.description: The employee notifies the system that they have sent the tag and that the invoice is now paid by providing the invoice refrance.

data.name: Attempt Login
data.description: The users username and password are sent(hashed) and checked agenst the data base to see if there is a match

data.name: Ack login
data.description: Sends if the login was successfull or not for the user

data.name: Log User login attempt
data.description: logs a users attempt at logging in

data.name: Enter Dog Registration Information
data.description:
Enters the information for registering a dog.
the human pronoun, first and last name, email address, and physical address, and the dog's name and breed. This information is used to create a new entry in the database.

threats.title: Data manipulation
threats.description: Someone could do a man-in-the middle attack and view and manipulate the data while it is in transit.
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS this is prevented as the data is encrypted in transit so they could only do this if they got the data from the connection at the very start.

threats.title: Information Spying
threats.description: Someone could be a man in the middle and spy on people using the application, therefore getting information like their address and email
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS, someone would need to see the start of the communication to be able to intercept the communication.

data.name: ACK
data.description: acknowledges that the registration was successful, and informs the owner of the registration number and expiry date for the registration.

threats.title: Spying
threats.description: some one could spy on the infomation while it is in transit.
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS, someone would need to see the start of the communication to be able to intercept the communication.

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: Acknowledgement could be tampered with; i.e., changing registration number to another registration. Since this is used in the reference for a bank transfer, the owner could end up failing to pay their own registration.
threats.mitigation: Use HTTPS

data.name: attempt login
data.description: Sends username and password to attempt to login

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could do a man-in-the middle attack and view and manipulate the data while it is in transit.
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS, this is prevented as the data is encrypted in transit, so they could only do this if they got the data from the connection at the very start.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could spy on the information while it is in transit.
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS, someone would need to see the start of the communication to be able to intercept the communication.

data.name: Ack Login
data.description: Send data that acknowledges the login was successful or not.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could do a man-in-the middle attack and view and manipulate the data while it is in transit.
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS, this is prevented as the data is encrypted in transit, so they could only do this if they got the data from the connection at the very start.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could spy on the information while it is in transit.
threats.mitigation: By using HTTPS, someone would need to see the start of the communication to be able to intercept the communication.

data.name:
Renew
Registration
data.description:
HTTPS webpage endpoint(s) for renewing a dog's registration.
(Requires the user to be logged in.)

threats.title: Website Spoofing
threats.description: Someone could create a fake version of this website, causing people to give their information to the wrong people.
threats.mitigation:
- Prioritise shorter URLs
- Purchase and redirect from similar domains

threats.title: False Information
threats.description: Users could provide incorrect renewal details, such as an invalid address.
threats.mitigation: Validate addresses syntactically and through a location API.

threats.title: Claim against renewal
threats.description: Owners could claim they hadn't performed a registration renewal when they had.
threats.mitigation: - Log all renewal actions to the system. Include relevant information about the request, i.e., IP address, time/date

threats.title: Data Interception
threats.description: See renew form data

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: See renew form data

threats.title: Flooding Attack
threats.description: See renew form data

data.name:
Terminate
Registration
data.description:
HTTPS webpage endpoint(s) for terminating a dog's registration.
(Requires the user to be logged in.)

threats.title: Website Spoofing
threats.description: Someone could create a fake version of this website, causing people to give their information to the wrong people.
threats.mitigation:
- Prioritise shorter URLs
- Purchase and redirect from similar domains

threats.title: False Information
threats.description: Users could provide incorrect termination details, such as an invalid address.
threats.mitigation: Validate addresses syntactically and through a location API.

threats.title: Claim against termination
threats.description: Owners could claim they hadn't performed a registration termination when they had.
threats.mitigation: - Log all termination actions to the system. Include relevant information about the request, i.e., IP address, time/date

threats.title: Data Interception
threats.description: See terminate form data

threats.title: Flooding Attack
threats.description: See terminate form data

data.name:
Declare Lost
Dog
data.description:
HTTPS webpage endpoint(s) for declaring a dog as lost.
(Requires the user to be logged in.)

threats.title: Fake dog owner
threats.description: Someone else fills a fake form that a dog has been lost.
threats.mitigation: Have a login system for dog owners.

threats.title: Inserted code
threats.description: Code could be inserted into the form for the server to run.
threats.mitigation: Check the form inputs for any code.

threats.title: Claim against reporting lost
threats.description: Declares a dog lost and then claims later that they did not.
threats.mitigation: To log the IP date and time when someone claims a dog lost.

threats.title: Too many requests
threats.description: If too many requests are sent then the servers get overwhelmed and not be able to handle more lost dogs.
threats.mitigation:
Rate limit the number of form requests per user IP.
Limit the amount a dog can be lost to once an hour.

data.name:
Report 
Found Dog
data.description: HTTP webpage endpoint(s) for reporting a dog as found.

threats.title: Fake information
threats.description: Someone gives fake information about a found dog
threats.mitigation:
Check for a real address.
Log who makes claims and blacklist multiple fake reports.

threats.title: Inserted code
threats.description: Code could be inserted into the form for the server to run.
threats.mitigation: Check the form inputs for any code.

threats.title: Claim against finding dog
threats.description: Claims they did not make a report for finding a dog.
threats.mitigation: To log the IP date and time when someone claims to find a dog lost.

data.name:
Member of
the Public
data.description: Members of the public can report lost dogs they have found.

threats.title: Incorrect input
threats.description: Member of the public inputs incorrect dog tag or address (intentionally or unintentionally)
threats.mitigation:
Use location data from the user's device to determine address.
Require a photo of the dog tag.
Check if the tag with that id exists.
Ignore if the dog tag id is not lost within a reasonable distance of the owner's address.
Check address is valid.

data.name:
Council
Employee
data.description: A person who works for the company in an admin role for the system.

threats.title: Staff credentials could be stolen or guessed
threats.description: Someone could obtain or guess the credentials of a council employee, gaining access to the system when they shouldn't.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strong password rules (for length and character types, i.e., special characters). Block the use of common passwords and phrases. Require two-factor authentication for logging in. Periodically enforce changing passwords, and disallow the use of previous passwords. Automatically expire user sessions after a period of inactivity (i.e., 30 minutes), and after a total elapsed period (i.e., 8 hours). Consider funding and distributing to staff members an external password service, and educate about its usage.

threats.title: Staff member modifies a registration and claims otherwise
threats.description: A staff member with valid credentials could modify a dog's registration in the data store, then claim they didn't modify it.
threats.mitigation: Log all database transactions and employee logins to a file. Include the details of any transaction performed, along with other relevant information, such as the user who performed it and the time and date it occurred.

data.name:
Manage
Registration
data.description: Council-only end-point for viewing and manipulating the dog registration datastore directly.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A concil employee could get the personal information of people in the system for their own use e.g., they could get their X address if they have a dog and know some of their personal information.
threats.mitigation:
To request customer data, they need to use the invoice registration number, and only the address and the tag ID will be returned.
All actions by the employee are also recorded so that any malicious activity can be found, such as spamming possible dog tags.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could falsely claim that someone they know has paid for a tag when they have not.
threats.mitigation: All actions are logged, and work is checked over by other employees.

data.name:
Employee
Credential
Datastore
data.description: Stores all council employee credentials.

data.name: Notifcation Service
data.description:
Used to notify user of changes invoices.
(Requires the user to be logged in.)

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Too many mail requests could be made that cause the system to only send some of them.
threats.mitigation: Rate limit intraction with the emailer and keep a stack of all the emails that still need to be sent.

threats.title: Fake Invoice
threats.description: An attacker could create a fake invoice in the same style as the real invoices and send them to customers they know are getting dogs and are in the area, so that they can steal money from them.
threats.mitigation:
The invoices would contain all the information you entered about you and your dog, including the random ID, which the registration form will ask the user to keep for this purpose, so that to accurately fake an invoice, the attacker would have to have access to the database.

Well, in the likely case that a user forgot their tag ID, they would still need their other information, to create a convincing invoice. But most people would still be tricked by an official looking invoice even if it was not perfect.

data.name: Banking System
data.description: Used to transfer money between accounts so that money can be paid
data.reasonOutOfScope: The system only indirectly interacts with this as dog owners pay outside the system and council employees check the accounts outside the system.

data.name:
Tag manufacturing
 and sending system
data.description: The system for creating and sending the tags to dog owners
data.reasonOutOfScope: The council employee manually requests the tags to be made and shipped out of any of the systems.

text.text:
Threats like Man in the
middle are not applicable
as this is an internal server.

data.name:
Threats like Man in the
middle are not applicable
as this is an internal server.

threats.title: Fake user
threats.description: Another person gains access to a animal controllers account
threats.mitigation:
Implement a multifactor login system
Enforce strong password polices

threats.title: False claims
threats.description: Claim that a dog has been collected when it has not been. Or claim a dog is still missing when it has been found.
threats.mitigation: Log when user signs in and out and what they interact with.

data.name: Log DataStore
data.description: Stores all logs for the system

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: User Login
data.description: Used to log users in

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Someone could create a fake version of this website, causing people to give their information to the wrong people.
threats.mitigation:
- Prioritise shorter URLs
- Purchase and redirect from similar domains

threats.title: Fake login
threats.description: Someone could log in as someone else.
threats.mitigation:
All passwords are required to be at least 8 characters long and contain a number, letter, and special charter.

Use a CAPTCHA to prevent them from automating it.

From M1036
Set account lockout policies after a certain number of failed login attempts to prevent passwords from being guessed. (Use 3 attempts and 10 minites before the next allowed attempt from the IP address or for that specific account.)

threats.title: Flood Endpoint
threats.description: Some one could flood the endpoint with fake login attempts to force the end point down.
threats.mitigation: Use IP blocking to prevent one address from being repetedly used.

threats.title: Flood User acount.
threats.description: Someone could repeatly fake attempting to login in to an account to trick the system into makeing that account not useable.
threats.mitigation: Use a CAPTCHA to prevent them from automating it and block IP addresses that repeatedly attempt to login to the same account.
